28.comment: Genital Structure: Pokémon: Animalistic: Bulbasaur: Male

29.comment: Genital Structure: Pokémon: Animalistic: Bulbasaur: Female

30.comment: Genital Structure: Pokémon: Animalistic: Bulbasaur: Futanari
30.content:
{{getvar::male_genital_structure}},
{{getvar::female_genital_structure}},
      "integration_notes": {
        "description": "Futanari Bulbasaur possess both male and female reproductive systems harmoniously integrated within the same organism. Both structures are fully functional and hormonally synchronized, supported by the plant-bulb symbiont.",
        "reproductive_integration": "The reproductive vine emerging from the bulb serves dual roles—capable of delivering gametes or stimulating ovule response through direct pollination contact. Female structures remain ventrally positioned and can receive gametes from other Bulbasaur or from the individual's own vine under rare circumstances.",
        "fertility": "Self-fertilization is possible but biologically inefficient, occurring only under conditions of isolation or extreme environmental stress.",
        "symbiotic_regulation": "The bulb’s vascular and hormonal system mediates reproductive balance, preventing internal conflict between gamete types. During fertility peaks, the bulb emits intensified scent compounds and soft bioluminescent pulses.",
        "behavioral_notes": "Futanari Bulbasaur exhibit heightened pheromone output and longer courtship displays, often serving as both pollinator and pollinated partner within their ecosystems."
      }

35.comment: Genital Structure: Tauric: Tauric: Mermaid: Futanari
35.content:
{{getvar::male_genital_structure}},
{{getvar::female_genital_structure}},
      "integration_notes": {
        "description": "Futanari mermaids possess both male and female reproductive systems housed within a single ventral cloacal chamber. Both are fully functional and hormonally balanced by aquatic endocrine adaptation.",
        "fertility": "Capable of fertilizing and carrying offspring; dual-cycle synchronization triggered by lunar phases or tidal conditions.",
        "unique_traits": "During heightened reproductive state, the cloacal fins glow with soft bioluminescent hues matching the mermaid’s scale color."
      }

40.comment: Genital Structure: Anthropomorphic: Animalistic: Feline: Futanari
40.content:
{{getvar::male_genital_structure}},
{{getvar::female_genital_structure}},
      "integration_notes": {
        "description": "Futanari felines possess both male and female reproductive anatomy integrated harmoniously. The external sheath and vulva share a single ventral placement, functionally independent but hormonally synchronized.",
        "fertility": "Both systems are viable; capable of self-fertilization in rare magical or genetic variants.",
        "unique_traits": "Heightened pheromone output and extended estrus duration; considered potent attractors in most anthropomorphic feline cultures."
      }

{{getvar::female_genital_structure}},
      "integration_notes": {
        "description": "Futanari felines possess a fully functional combination of male and female reproductive organs positioned within the same ventral region. The penile sheath and vulva coexist in a shared but partitioned structure.",
        "fertility": "Capable of both insemination and conception; dual hormonal cycle synchronized with seasonal estrus.",
        "unique_traits": "Enhanced pheromone production and prolonged mating drive; observed in mythic or magically altered feline lineages."
      }

53.comment: Genital Structure: Anthropomorphic: Pokémon: Bulbasaur: Male

54.comment: Genital Structure: Anthropomorphic: Pokémon: Bulbasaur: Female

55.comment: Genital Structure: Anthropomorphic: Pokémon: Bulbasaur: Futanari
55.content:
{{getvar::male_genital_structure}},
{{getvar::female_genital_structure}},
      "integration_notes": {
        "description": "Futanari Bulbasaur possess both male and female reproductive systems integrated harmoniously within the humanoid body and the dorsal bulb symbiont.",
        "reproductive_integration": "The dorsal vine serves as an active intromittent organ and may stimulate the ventral reproductive region directly or with a partner. Internal systems are fully functional and hormonally coordinated through the bulb.",
        "fertility": "Capable of natural conception or self-fertilization in rare environmental extremes; bulb luminescence intensifies during simultaneous fertility cycles.",
        "symbiotic_regulation": "The bulb’s internal hormones manage reproductive equilibrium and emit pheromones that attract both male and female Bulbasaur variants.",
        "behavioral_notes": "Exhibit heightened empathy and pheromone sensitivity; known for longer and more nurturing courtship behavior."
      }

58.comment: Genital Structure: Beastkin: Pokémon: Bulbasaur: Male

59.comment: Genital Structure: Beastkin: Pokémon: Bulbasaur: Female

60.comment: Genital Structure: Beastkin: Pokémon: Bulbasaur: Futanari
60.content:
{{getvar::male_genital_structure}},
{{getvar::female_genital_structure}},
      "integration_notes": {
        "description": "Beastkin Bulbasaur Futanari exhibit both floral-based male and female reproductive organs, each capable of independent or synchronized function. Both feature natural petaloid openings that respond to light and hormonal cycles.",
        "flower_morphology": "The phallic petal crown and vulvar bloom emit compatible pheromones during arousal, creating a distinct sweet-scented resonance when both are active.",
        "reproductive_integration": "The bulb symbiont governs hormonal synchronization, ensuring balanced fertility phases and preventing auto-fertilization except under rare environmental duress.",
        "fertility": "Self-fertilization is biologically possible but discouraged by natural hormonal dampening; normally requires external pollination or partner interaction.",
        "behavioral_traits": "Emotional or romantic excitement triggers simultaneous petal expansion and light emission from both genital structures; bulb glows bright green during dual fertility peaks."
      }
